channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on dock with wet outter contents, package was placed in salvage drum for further investigation DescribePack: upon further investigation, it was found that 1 of the 4 inner containers was leaking from the closure, causing internal leakage DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: package was placed into a hazardous waste bag, and then into a salvage drum

item.title: Report E-2023090765
item.description:
Report E-2023090765

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: LUMBERTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 55 gallon drums of optisperse (un1760) had released 55 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023090342
item.description:
Report X-2023090342

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The actual sequence of events that lead to the damage of the package is unknown. Package had been found about 6 hours after the close of the morning sort when the initial damage had occurred. Once damage package was discovered, action was taken to isolate the package in the appropriate holding area to further examine and process the package. DescribePack: Package failure was the main closure cap on one of the bottles in the package. It leaked onto the top flaps of the shipping carton. Amount leaked was equal to about two tablespoons of liquid. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Once damage package was discovered, action was taken to isolate the package in the appropriate holding area away from the general work area. Leakage/release was contained to just the outer pack.

item.title: Report E-2023090780
item.description:
Report E-2023090780

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T00:33:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-02
  • City: REIDSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver had a 10 gallons spill of regular fuel at the murphy site. Driver did not report the spill to Eagle Transport - Greensboro dispatch. Murphy reported 8 months afterwards that they got their cleanup crew on site (Carolina Environmental Response Team) to clean up the 10-gallon spill. Driver no longer works for Eagle Transport.
